issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
YARN-7326 leveraged the ANY record type for upstream resolution, but some implementations [don't support ANY|https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-dnsop-refuse-any-06] due to the potential for abuse, namely Cloudflare. Docker Hub leverages Cloudflare for image distribution, so when Registry DNS is used as the sole resolver, docker image downloads are failing. 
{code:java}
[root@host ~]# docker run -u root -it centos bash
Unable to find image 'centos:latest' locally
latest: Pulling from library/centos
469cfcc7a4b3: Already exists
docker: error pulling image configuration: Get https://production.cloudflare.docker.com/registry-v2/docker/registry/v2/blobs/sha256/e9/e934aafc22064b7322c0250f1e32e5ce93b2d19b356f4537f5864bd102e8531f/data?verify=1527265495-nG8jk%2Bya9qrdPVlXRKGMnOhSnV0%3D: dial tcp: lookup production.cloudflare.docker.com on registry.dns.host:53: no such host.
{code}
{code:java}
[root@host~]# nslookup production.cloudflare.docker.com registry.dns.host
Server:		registry.dns.host
Address:	registry.dns.host#53

Non-authoritative answer:
production.cloudflare.docker.com	hinfo = "ANY obsoleted" "See draft-ietf-dnsop-refuse-any"
{code}
fields.summary: Revisit the record type used by Registry DNS for upstream resolution

comments.body: [~eyang] - I have a WIP patch that checks the response from the ANY request for HINFO and falls back to requesting the A records if HINFO is found. This works, but I don't think it's the right fix. Can you share your thoughts on how we might want to handle this?

[~shanekumpf@gmail.com] We have several options:

Option 1, default lookup to A CNAME PTR SOA MX only for remote lookup.
Option 2, lookup through the query type, and return the first found record:
A NS MD MF CNAME SOA MB MG MR NULL WKS PTR HINFO MINFO MX TXT
Option 3, lookup any and fall back to A NS MD MF CNAME SOA MB MG MR NULL WKS PTR HINFO MINFO MX TXT

Option 1 reduces the lookup time, and option 3 is most compatible.

Thanks for the input [~eyang]! The suggestions makes sense as a response to ANY. I did some testing here and I'm starting to think we should just retain the client query type in the upstream request. I've put together a patch to do so, let me know what you think of this approach.

[~shanekumpf@gmail.com] Thanks for the patch.  This change will break recursion fix that was put in YARN-7326 based on Allen's comments, but I think this is fine to harden DNS to prevent [reflection attacks|https://www.us-cert.gov/ncas/alerts/TA13-088A].  I will commit this tomorrow, if no objections.
+1 I just committed this to trunk and branch-3.1.  Thank you [~shanekumpf@gmail.com].

SUCCESS: Integrated in Jenkins build Hadoop-trunk-Commit #14358 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/14358/])
YARN-8365.  Set DNS query type according to client request.             (eyang: rev 5cf37418bdc6ff09c0c1ae3ac8ac4b0867de0de4)
